<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Value handle that is nullable, but tries to track the Value.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This is a value handle that tries hard to point to a Value, even across</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// RAUW operations, but will null itself out if the value is destroyed.  this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// is useful for advisory sorts of information, but should not be used as the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// key of a map (since the map would have to rearrange itself when the pointer</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// changes).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/weaktrackingvh"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/weaktrackingvh/#a27d4a282d9ddbd93893e1ada30288b53">WeakTrackingVH</a> : </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/valuehandlebase/#afd6a51b0b16b598bc41a2b32c6d0030f">ValueHandleBase</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Value handle that asserts if the Value is deleted.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This is a Value Handle that points to a value and asserts out if the value</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// is destroyed while the handle is still live.  This is very useful for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// catching dangling pointer bugs and other things which can be non-obvious.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// One particularly useful place to use this is as the Key of a map.  Dangling</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// pointer bugs often lead to really subtle bugs that only occur if another</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// object happens to get allocated to the same address as the old one.  Using</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// an AssertingVH ensures that an assert is triggered as soon as the bad</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// delete occurs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Note that an AssertingVH handle does &#42;not&#42; follow values across RAUW</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// operations.  This means that RAUW&#39;s need to explicitly update the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// AssertingVH&#39;s as it moves.  This is required because in non-assert mode this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// class turns into a trivial wrapper around a pointer.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ValueTy&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/assertingvh"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/assertingvh/#a3bd43ce6246df58d73ff9f0fa3a025b2">AssertingVH</a></span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><span class="doxyHighlight">#<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/passes/passbuilderbindings-cpp/#acdfbcf188e2d4a80837e89de2ccdffab">if</a> LLVM&#95;ENABLE&#95;ABI&#95;BREAKING&#95;CHECKS</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><span class="doxyHighlight">    : </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/valuehandlebase">ValueHandleBase</a></span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#endif</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="264"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="310"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Treat AssertingVH&lt;T&gt; like T&#42; inside maps. This also allows using find&#95;as()</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="311"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to look up a value without constructing a value handle.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="312"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight">&lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> T&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="313" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/densemapinfo-9991f1503f02220ff60e93f014753ab7"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/densemapinfo">DenseMapInfo</a>&lt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/assertingvh">AssertingVH</a>&lt;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/mips/mips16isellowering-cpp/#a0acb682b8260ab1c60b918599864e2e5">T</a>&gt;&gt; : <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/densemapinfo">DenseMapInfo</a>&lt;T &#42;&gt; &#123;&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="314"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="315"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Value handle that tracks a Value across RAUW.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="316"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// TrackingVH is designed for situations where a client needs to hold a handle</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// to a Value (or subclass) across some operations which may move that value,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// but should never destroy it or replace it with some unacceptable type.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// It is an error to attempt to replace a value with one of a type which is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// incompatible with any of its outstanding TrackingVHs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// It is an error to read from a TrackingVH that does not point to a valid</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="325"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// value.  A TrackingVH is said to not point to a valid value if either it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// hasn&#39;t yet been assigned a value yet or because the value it was tracking</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// has since been deleted.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Assigning a value to a TrackingVH is always allowed, even if said TrackingVH</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="330"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// no longer points to a valid value.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="331" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/trackingvh"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ValueTy&gt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/trackingvh/#ae231032c8ce1c9818469098cfc880c0b">TrackingVH</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="332"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/weaktrackingvh">WeakTrackingVH</a> InnerHandle;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="333"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="334"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="335" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/trackingvh/#a3249c6d006cdfe254ce0e6c808260bfb"><span class="doxyHighlight">  ValueTy &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/trackingvh/#a3249c6d006cdfe254ce0e6c808260bfb">getValPtr</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="336"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(InnerHandle.pointsToAliveValue() &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><span class="doxyHighlight">           </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;TrackingVH must be non-null and valid on dereference!&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Check that the value is a member of the correct subclass. We would like</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to check this property on assignment for better debugging, but we don&#39;t</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// want to require a virtual interface on this VH. Instead we allow RAUW to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="342"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// replace this value with a value of an invalid type, and check it here.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="343"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a92ca992e52dddc420f4b069cae06dfbe">isa&lt;ValueTy&gt;</a>(InnerHandle) &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="344"><span class="doxyHighlight">           </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Tracked Value was replaced by one with an invalid type!&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="345"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac4fc845f5ed92de63cd4474f128f5fc5">cast&lt;ValueTy&gt;</a>(InnerHandle);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="346"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="347"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="348" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/trackingvh/#a60eafa771c60b7fe3fea140fc38ccebd"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/trackingvh/#a60eafa771c60b7fe3fea140fc38ccebd">setValPtr</a>(ValueTy &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/option/option-cpp/#a04665169063c8ca1f2ea96c27fc7c2b2">P</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="349"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Assigning to non-valid TrackingVH&#39;s are fine so we just unconditionally</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="350"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// assign here.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="351"><span class="doxyHighlight">    InnerHandle = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/trackingvh/#a59f7928a8ccd3a9db6a7d6cd6563ae6e">GetAsValue</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/option/option-cpp/#a04665169063c8ca1f2ea96c27fc7c2b2">P</a>);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00376" /><CodeLine lineNumber="376"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Value handle with callbacks on RAUW and destruction.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00377" /><CodeLine lineNumber="377"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00378" /><CodeLine lineNumber="378"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This is a value handle that allows subclasses to define callbacks that run</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00379" /><CodeLine lineNumber="379"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// when the underlying Value has RAUW called on it or is destroyed.  This</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00381" /><CodeLine lineNumber="381"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the map before calling setValPtr() (since the map has to rearrange itself</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00403" /><CodeLine lineNumber="403"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Callback for Value destruction.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00404" /><CodeLine lineNumber="404"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00405" /><CodeLine lineNumber="405"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Called when this-&gt;getValPtr() is destroyed, inside ~Value(), so you</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00406" /><CodeLine lineNumber="406"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// may call any non-virtual Value method on getValPtr(), but no subclass</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00407" /><CodeLine lineNumber="407"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// methods.  If WeakTrackingVH were implemented as a CallbackVH, it would use</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00408" /><CodeLine lineNumber="408"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00409" /><CodeLine lineNumber="409"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// method to call setValPtr(NULL).  AssertingVH would use this method to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00410" /><CodeLine lineNumber="410"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// cause an assertion failure.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="411"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00412" /><CodeLine lineNumber="412"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// All implementations must remove the reference from this object to the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00413" /><CodeLine lineNumber="413"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Value that&#39;s being destroyed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00414" /><CodeLine lineNumber="414" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbackvh/#a93891950be05a0bae5743979913e13f3"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">virtual</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbackvh/#a93891950be05a0bae5743979913e13f3">deleted</a>() &#123; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbackvh/#ab3a25e82043f8a99ad6ed61fb9c9483c">setValPtr</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">); &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00415" /><CodeLine lineNumber="415"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00416" /><CodeLine lineNumber="416"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Callback for Value RAUW.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00417" /><CodeLine lineNumber="417"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00418" /><CodeLine lineNumber="418"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Called when this-&gt;getValPtr()-&gt;replaceAllUsesWith(new&#95;value) is called,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00419" /><CodeLine lineNumber="419"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// &#95;before&#95; any of the uses have actually been replaced.  If WeakTrackingVH</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00420" /><CodeLine lineNumber="420"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// were</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00421" /><CodeLine lineNumber="421"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// implemented as a CallbackVH, it would use this method to call</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00422" /><CodeLine lineNumber="422"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// setValPtr(new&#95;value).  AssertingVH would do nothing in this method.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00423" /><CodeLine lineNumber="423" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbackvh/#a1f633ad5396b6726039d26f5bbac940d"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">virtual</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbackvh/#a1f633ad5396b6726039d26f5bbac940d">allUsesReplacedWith</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/valuehandlebase/#aeceedf6e1a7d48a588516ce2b1983d6f">Value</a> &#42;) &#123;&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00424" /><CodeLine lineNumber="424"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00425" /><CodeLine lineNumber="425"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="426"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Value handle that poisons itself if the Value is deleted.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="427"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="428"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This is a Value Handle that points to a value and poisons itself if the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="429"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// value is destroyed while the handle is still live.  This is very useful for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00430" /><CodeLine lineNumber="430"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// catching dangling pointer bugs where an \\c AssertingVH cannot be used</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00431" /><CodeLine lineNumber="431"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// because the dangling handle needs to outlive the value without ever being</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00432" /><CodeLine lineNumber="432"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// used.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00433" /><CodeLine lineNumber="433"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00434" /><CodeLine lineNumber="434"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// One particularly useful place to use this is as the Key of a map. Dangling</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00435" /><CodeLine lineNumber="435"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// pointer bugs often lead to really subtle bugs that only occur if another</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00436" /><CodeLine lineNumber="436"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// object happens to get allocated to the same address as the old one. Using</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00437" /><CodeLine lineNumber="437"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// a PoisoningVH ensures that an assert is triggered if looking up a new value</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00438" /><CodeLine lineNumber="438"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// in the map finds a handle from the old value.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00439" /><CodeLine lineNumber="439"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00440" /><CodeLine lineNumber="440"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Note that a PoisoningVH handle does &#42;not&#42; follow values across RAUW</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00441" /><CodeLine lineNumber="441"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// operations. This means that RAUW&#39;s need to explicitly update the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00442" /><CodeLine lineNumber="442"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// PoisoningVH&#39;s as it moves. This is required because in non-assert mode this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00443" /><CodeLine lineNumber="443"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// class turns into a trivial wrapper around a pointer.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00444" /><CodeLine lineNumber="444"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ValueTy&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00445" /><CodeLine lineNumber="445" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/poisoningvh"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/poisoningvh/#a32ad059aca7204b24d7077172709e537">PoisoningVH</a> final</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00446" /><CodeLine lineNumber="446"><span class="doxyHighlight">#<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/passes/passbuilderbindings-cpp/#acdfbcf188e2d4a80837e89de2ccdffab">if</a> LLVM&#95;ENABLE&#95;ABI&#95;BREAKING&#95;CHECKS</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00447" /><CodeLine lineNumber="447"><span class="doxyHighlight">    : </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbackvh">CallbackVH</a></span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00448" /><CodeLine lineNumber="448"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#endif</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00449" /><CodeLine lineNumber="449"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00450" /><CodeLine lineNumber="450"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">friend</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/densemapinfo">DenseMapInfo</a>&lt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/poisoningvh/#a32ad059aca7204b24d7077172709e537">PoisoningVH</a>&lt;ValueTy&gt;&gt;;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00453" /><CodeLine lineNumber="453"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;GetAsValue(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;V) &#123; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> V; &#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00457" /><CodeLine lineNumber="457"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// A flag tracking whether this value has been poisoned.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00458" /><CodeLine lineNumber="458"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00459" /><CodeLine lineNumber="459"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// On delete and RAUW, we leave the value pointer alone so that as a raw</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00460" /><CodeLine lineNumber="460"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// pointer it produces the same value (and we fit into the same key of</span></CodeLine>
